testCase.expectations:
- titles should include broad topics like "Ciência da Computação", "Programação", "Desenvolvimento de Software"
      - may include other related topics to coding and programming
      - all titles and descriptions in Brazilian Portuguese

      
  - Focus only on title field, no need to pay attention to the description
  - It's okay for description to have issues, focus on the title
  - The description should NOT have an impact on scoring unless it's written in the wrong language
  - Title should NOT have level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - Title should NOT have words like "course" in the title
  - Titles are in Title Case
  - Not following title guidelines is a major error

steps.conclusion: None. The titles follow Title Case, avoid levels and joiners improperly, match the app language (Brazilian Portuguese), and descriptions are in the correct language with one sentence each.

The set of titles for a vague intent (“I want to code”) omits some broad canonical courses expected by the guidelines, such as “Ciência da Computação”, “Programação”, and “Desenvolvimento de Software”.

Add broader canonical titles like “Ciência da Computação”, “Programação”, and “Desenvolvimento de Software”, and optionally expand related suggestions (e.g., “Engenharia de Software”, “Banco de Dados”, “Desenvolvimento de Aplicativos Móveis”, “Controle de Versão com Git”) to better cover common pathways for coding.

Possible minor guideline tension: one title uses a connector between two topics ("Derechos Humanos y Derecho Penal"), which could be interpreted as joining topics; while not clearly prohibited for multi-topic courses, it slightly risks the "avoid 'and' in single-topic titles" rule.

Could avoid the "y" connector by reframing as a single-theme title (e.g., "Derechos Humanos en el Ámbito Penal"); could expand with additional relevant titles like "Teoría del Delito", "Derecho Penitenciario", "Penología", "Derecho Penal Internacional", or "Responsabilidad Penal de las Personas Jurídicas".
